1.name: The Quiet Man
1.description: A retired American boxer returns to the village of his birth in Ireland, where he finds love.

2.name: Singin' in the Rain
2.description: A silent film production company and cast make a difficult transition to sound.

3.name: Lovely to Look At
3.description: Three Broadway producers struggling to get backing for their show hope one's sudden inheritance of a half interest in a Parisian fashion house is the answer. They travel to Paris only to learn the salon is in debt and requires their help.

4.name: High Noon
4.description: A town Marshal, despite the disagreements of his newlywed bride and the townspeople around him, must face a gang of deadly killers alone at high noon when the gang leader, an outlaw he sent up years ago, arrives on the noon train.

5.name: The Greatest Show on Earth
5.description: The dramatic lives of trapeze artists, a clown, and an elephant trainer are told against a background of circus spectacle.

6.name: Ikiru
6.description: A bureaucrat tries to find a meaning in his life after he discovers he has terminal cancer.

7.name: Bend of the River
7.description: When a town boss confiscates homesteader's supplies after gold is discovered nearby, a tough cowboy risks his life to try and get it to them.

8.name: Road to Bali
8.description: Two unemployed show-biz pals accept treasure-diving work in Bali for a local princess and they find treasure, love and trouble.

9.name: The Duel at Silver Creek
9.description: Marshal Tyrone and the Silver Kid form an uneasy alliance against a gang of claim jumpers.

10.name: Viva Zapata!
10.description: The story of Mexican revolutionary Emiliano Zapata, who led a rebellion against the corrupt, oppressive dictatorship of president Porfirio Diaz in the early 20th century.

11.name: Limelight
11.description: A fading comedian and a suicidally despondent ballet dancer must look to each other to find meaning and hope in their lives.

12.name: The Iron Mistress
12.description: The life of nineteenth-century pioneer Jim Bowie is portrayed.

13.name: The Bad and the Beautiful
13.description: An unscrupulous movie producer uses an actress, a director and a writer to achieve success.

14.name: The Cimarron Kid
14.description: Unjustly accused of robbing the train he was riding home, Bill Doolin re-joins his old gang, participates in other robberies and becomes a wanted outlaw.

15.name: So Little Time
15.description: During World War II, German soldiers occupy the home of a beautiful Belgian girl and her mother.

16.name: Sudden Fear
16.description: After an ambitious actor insinuates himself into the life of a wealthy middle-aged playwright and marries her, he plots with his mistress to murder her.

17.name: Phone Call from a Stranger
17.description: While waiting on a delayed flight, David Trask, who has left his unfaithful wife, meets three of his fellow passengers. When the aircraft crashes, he is one of few survivors, and sets out to resolve their unfinished business.

18.name: Monkey Business
18.description: A chemist finds his personal and professional life turned upside down when one of his chimpanzees finds the fountain of youth.

19.name: Moulin Rouge
19.description: Fictional account of French artist Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec.

20.name: 5 Fingers
20.description: During WWII the valet to the British Ambassador to Ankara sells British secrets to the Germans while trying to romance a refugee Polish countess.

21.name: Ivanhoe
21.description: A knight seeks to free the captive King Richard and put him back on the throne.

22.name: Umberto D.
22.description: An elderly man and his dog struggle to survive on his government pension in Rome.

23.name: Don't Bother to Knock
23.description: After being dumped by his girlfriend, an airline pilot pursues a babysitter in his hotel and gradually realizes she's dangerous.

24.name: Springfield Rifle
24.description: Major Lex Kearney becomes the North's first counterespionage agent as he tries to discover who's behind the theft of Union cavalry horses in Colorado during the Civil War.

25.name: Untamed Frontier
25.description: Squeezed between Mexico and the Denbow family lands lies the U.S. government free grazing land but the incoming settlers cannot reach it without trespassing on the Denbow property which is defended by an army of Denbow cowhands.

26.name: The Snows of Kilimanjaro
26.description: Writer Harry Street reflects on his life as he lies dying from an infection while on safari in the shadow of Mount Kilamanjaro.

27.name: Washington Story
27.description: Joe Gresham is a hard-working but reticent congressman from Massachusetts. Reporter Alice Kingsley arrives in Washington, DC hired by Gilbert Nunnally, a tabloid columnist and cynic who ...                See full summary »

28.name: Kansas City Confidential
28.description: An ex-con trying to go straight is framed for a million dollar armored car robbery and must go to Mexico in order to unmask the real culprits.

29.name: The Big Sky
29.description: The success of the journey focuses on keeping the Indian girl alive as well as themselves to complete trade with the Blackfeet.

30.name: Macao
30.description: Nick Cochran, an American in exile in Macao, has a chance to restore his name by helping capture an international crime lord. Undercover, can he mislead the bad guys and still woo the handsome singer/petty crook, Julie Benson?

31.name: O. Henry's Full House
31.description: John Steinbeck introduces a quintet of five of O. Henry's most celebrated stories from his New York Period (1902-1910) in this anthology film.

32.name: Come Back, Little Sheba
32.description: An emotionally remote recovering alcoholic and his dowdy, unambitious wife face a personal crisis when they take in an attractive lodger.

33.name: Scaramouche
33.description: In France during the late 18th Century, a man sets out to avenge the death of his friend at the hands of a master swordsman.

34.name: The Narrow Margin
34.description: A woman planning to testify against the mob must be protected against their assassins on the train trip from Chicago to Los Angeles.

35.name: Clash by Night
35.description: Mae Doyle comes back to her hometown a cynical woman. Her brother Joe fears that his love, fish cannery worker Peggy, may wind up like Mae. Mae marries Jerry and has a baby; she is happy but restless, drawn to Jerry's friend Earl.

36.name: The Importance of Being Earnest
36.description: When Algernon discovers that his friend, Ernest, has created a fictional brother for whenever he needs a reason to escape dull country life, Algernon poses as the brother, resulting in ever increasing confusion.

37.name: Deadline - U.S.A.
37.description: With his newspaper about to be sold, crusading editor Ed Hutcheson tries to complete an exposé on gangster Rienzi.

38.name: The Story of Robin Hood and His Merrie Men
38.description: With King Richard away at the crusades, Prince John rules England with an iron fist and tasks the Sheriff of Nottingham with the collection of high taxes and the capture of outlaw Robin Hood.

39.name: Pat and Mike
39.description: Pat is a women's sports sensation unless her fiancé is around. Her new shady manager Mike keeps them apart and develops feelings for her.

40.name: Jeux interdits
40.description: A young French girl orphaned in a Nazi air attack is befriended by the son of a poor farmer, and together they try to come to terms with the realities of death.

41.name: My Cousin Rachel
41.description: A young man plots revenge against the woman he believes murdered his cousin, but his plans are shaken when he comes face to face with the enigmatic beauty.

42.name: Rancho Notorious
42.description: After the murder of his fiancée, a Wyoming ranch hand sets out to find her killer.

43.name: Emergency Call
43.description: Scotland Yard is mobilised in the hunt for blood donors in a race to save a dying girl.

44.name: Affair in Trinidad
44.description: Nightclub singer and her brother-in-law try to find her husband's killer.

45.name: The Prisoner of Zenda
45.description: An Englishman vacationing in a Ruritarian kingdom is recruited to impersonate his cousin, the soon-to-be-crowned king when the monarch is drugged and kidnapped.

46.name: Hans Christian Andersen
46.description: The opening scene of the movie describes it best: "Once upon a time there lived in Denmark a great storyteller named Hans Christian Andersen. This is not the story of his life, but a fairy tale about the great spinner of fairy tales."

47.name: Lo sceicco bianco
47.description: During a day in their honeymoon, a couple is separated by the city's lust and the desires it produces.

48.name: Pony Soldier
48.description: In 1876, a Canadian North West Mounted Police Constable must obtain the release of white hostages captured by the Cree tribes that are raiding Montana from their Canadian reservation.

49.name: We're Not Married!
49.description: In separate stories, five wedded couples learn that they are not legally married.

50.name: Europa '51
50.description: A wealthy woman becomes obsessed with humanitarianism when her young son dies after committing suicide.
